trans-unit.source: Validates that another control's value falls within an allowable range.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The minimum and maximum values of the range are provided either directly or by reference to another control.
This class behaves identically to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RangeValidator?displayProperty=fullName> control.
By default, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> controls on a form raise validator controls on the form to perform validation when the form is submitted to the server.
To disable automatic validation, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CausesValidation%2A> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> to `false`.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RangeValidator"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Determines whether the properties to be validated are valid.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RangeValidator.MinimumValue*> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RangeValidator.MaximumValue*> properties have valid values; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Either the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RangeValidator.MinimumValue*> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RangeValidator.MaximumValue*> properties have invalid types, -or- the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RangeValidator.MinimumValue*> is larger than <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RangeValidator.MaximumValue*>.
Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of a Web base validator.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None
Called during the validation stage when ASP.NET processes a Web Form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None
Gets or sets the value of the control that you are validating, which must be less than or equal to the value of this property.
The default value is an empty string ("").
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The maximum value of the range to validate against.
Gets or sets the value of the control that you are validating, which must be greater than or equal to the value of this property.
The default value is an empty string ("").
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The minimum value of the range to validate against.
Gets or sets the data type that specifies how to interpret the values being compared.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The values are implicitly converted to the specified data type before the comparison is made.
If the data conversion fails, data validation fails.
The following table contains the definitions of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidationDataType> enumerations.
|Enumerations|Value|Data Type| |------------------|-----------|---------------| |String|0|String| |Integer|1|Integer| |Double|2|Double| |Date|3|DateTime| |Currency|4|Currency|
The data type that specifies how to interpret the values being compared.
The specified value is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidationDataType"></xref> values.
